sen.j: 頼政塚（よりまさづか）は現在の亀岡市西つつじヶ丘町の小高い丘に建てられた、平安末期非業の死を遂げた多田源氏源頼政の首塚。
sen.e: Built on a small hill in present Nishi-Tsutsujigaoka-cho, Kameoka City, the Yorimasa-zuka tumulus is a Kubi-zuka (burial mound for heads) of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Tada-Genji clan, who died an unnatural death towards the end of the Heian period.

Built on a small hill in present day Nishi-Tsutsujigaoka-cho, Kameoka City, the Yorimasa-zuka tumulus is the Kubi-zuka (burial mound for heads) of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Tada-Genji clan, who died an untimely death towards the end of the Heian period.

Built on a small hill in present day Nishi-Tsutsujigaoka-cho, Kameoka City, the Yorimasa-zuka Tumulus is the Kubizuka (tomb of the head) of MINAMOTO no Yorimasa of the Tada-Genji (Minamoto clan), who died an untimely death towards the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 宇治で戦死した頼政の遺骸がここに埋められた理由として、丹波矢田郷が彼の領地の中で最も宇治に近かったからと言われているが
sen.e: It is said that the body of Yorimasa who died in a battle at Uji was not buried here, because the Tanba Yada-go country was nearest to Uji among his territories.
It is said that the body of Yorimasa who died in a battle at Uji was not buried here, because the Tanba Yada-go country was of all his territories the nearest to Uji.
It is said that the body of Yorimasa who died in a battle at Uji was not buried here, because the Tanba Yada-go Village was of all his territories the nearest to Uji.

sen.j: 江戸時代に近辺の僧侶が存在を疑って塚を掘り起こしてみたところ、石棺があったといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that in the Edo period, a priest around there doubted its existence, excavated the tumulus, and found a stone coffin there.
It is said that in the Edo Period, a local priest doubted its existence, excavated the tumulus, and found a stone coffin there.

sen.j: 現在は亀岡市立つつじヶ丘小学校が隣接している
sen.e: Now, Kameoka City-run Nishi-Tsutsujigaoka elementary school is placed adjacent to the tumulus.

sen.j: 亀岡市篠町浄法寺の国道9号線に頼政塚の交差点があり、京阪京都交通にも頼政塚バス停がある。
sen.e: The Yorimasa-zuka crossing exists on national road 9 in Joboji, Shino-cho, Kameoka City, and a Yorimasa-zuka bus stop for buses of Keihan Kyoto Kotsu is also provided.
There is a Yorimasa-zuka crossing on national road 9 in Joboji, Shino-cho, Kameoka City, and a Yorimasa-zuka bus stop where Keihan Kyoto Kotsu buses stop.
